kw.name: Set SWT Bot Preferences TIMEOUT
kw.doc:
Set SWTBotPreferences TIMEOUT in time format
The timeout for finding widgets among other things. Defaults to 5000ms Example: | Set SWTBotPreferences TIMEOUT | 1 s |

kw.name: Set Text Text
kw.doc:
Set text into text
Example: | Set Text Text | text |

kw.name: SetSWTBotPreferencesDEFAULT KEY
kw.doc:
Set SWTBotPreferences DEFAULT_KEY
The default key used to match SWT widgets. Defaults to org.eclipse.swtbot.widget.key.Example: | Set SWTBotPreferences DEFAULT_KEY | org.eclipse.swtbot.widget.key |

kw.name: SetSWTBotPreferencesDEFAULT POLL DELAY
kw.doc:
Set SWTBotPreferences DEFAULT_POLL_DELAY in time format
The default time delay between successive polling while waiting for a condition to be evaluated. Defaults to 500ms. Example: | Set SWTBotPreferences DEFAULT_POLL_DELAY | 500ms |

kw.name: SetSWTBotPreferencesKEYBOARD LAYOUT
kw.doc:
Set SWTBotPreferences KEYBOARD_LAYOUT
The keyboard layout. This value is autodetected at runtime. This can be set using the system property 'org.eclipse.swtbot.keyboard.layout'. Note: the layout must be of the form foo.bar.baz.[MAC_][LANGUAGE_][COUNTRY_][VARIANT_] This expects a file named 'foo/bar/baz/[MAC_][LANGUAGE_][COUNTRY_][VARIANT_].keyboard'
Eg: Layout Name | Configuration File com.foo.bar.MAC.EN.US | com/foo/bar/MAC_EN_US.keyboard com.foo.bar.MAC.EN_GB | com/foo/bar/MAC_EN_GB.keyboard com.foo.bar.FR_FR | com/foo/bar/FR_FR.keyboard com.foo.bar.DE | /com/foo/bar/DE.keyboard
Example: | Set SWTBotPreferences KEYBOARD_LAYOUT | layout |

kw.name: SetSWTBotPreferencesKEYBOARD STRATEGY
kw.doc:
Set SWTBotPreferences KEYBOARD_STRATEGY
The default keyboard strategy. Defaults to org.eclipse.swtbot.swt.finder.keyboard.AWTKeyboardStrategy Example: | Set SWTBotPreferences KEYBOARD_STRATEGY | org.eclipse.swtbot.swt.finder.keyboard.AWTKeyboardStrategy |

kw.name: SetSWTBotPreferencesMAX ERROR SCREENSHOT COUNT
kw.doc:
Set SWTBotPreferences MAX_ERROR_SCREENSHOT_COUNT
The maximum number of screenshots that SWTBot should capture. Defaults to 100. Example: | Set SWTBotPreferences MAX_ERROR_SCREENSHOT_COUNT | 20 |

kw.name: SetSWTBotPreferencesPLAYBACK DELAY
kw.doc:
Set SWTBotPreferences PLAYBACK_DELAY in time format
The speed of playback in milliseconds. Defaults to 0 ms. Example: | Set SWTBotPreferences PLAYBACK_DELAY | 10 ms |

kw.name: SetSWTBotPreferencesRECORDER FILE NAME
kw.doc:
Set SWTBotPreferences RECORDER_FILE_NAME
The name of the file in which the recorder records. Defaults to 'swtbot.record.txt'. Example: | Set SWTBotPreferences RECORDER_FILE_NAME | filename |

kw.name: SetSWTBotPreferencesSCREENSHOT FORMAT
kw.doc:
Set SWTBotPreferences SCREENSHOT_FORMAT
The screenshot image format to be used. Defaults to 'jpeg' The value must be one these: BMP, GIF, ICO, JPEG, JPG, PNG or TIFF. Example: | Set SWTBotPreferences SCREENSHOT_FORMAT | PNG |

kw.name: SetSWTBotPreferencesSCREENSHOTS DIR
kw.doc:
Set SWTBotPreferences SCREENSHOTS_DIR
The directory in which screenshots should be generated. Defaults to './screenshots'. Example: | Set SWTBotPreferences SCREENSHOTS_DIR | ./screenshots |

kw.name: SetSWTBotPreferencesTYPE INTERVAL
kw.doc:
Set SWTBotPreferences TYPE_INTERVAL in time format
The the time interval in milliseconds between typing characters in a string. Defaults to 50ms Example: | Set SWTBotPreferences TYPE_INTERVAL | 20ms |

kw.name: Start Application
kw.doc: Alias for `Launch Application` keyword

kw.name: Start Application In Separate Thread
kw.doc:
Launches application in a separate thread with the given arguments. This is useful if your application does something that blocks eg. opens up a dialog.
Example: | Start Application In Separate Thread | _com.acme.myapplication.MyApp_ |

kw.name: Start SWT Bot Bridge
kw.doc: Start the SWTBot bridge This is used for SWT application that run without Eclipse/RCP. For RCP application use StartEclipse keyword Example: | Start SWTBotBridge |

kw.name: Wait Until Last Widget Is Enabled
kw.doc:
Wait until the last selected widget is enabled or the optional timeout is reached. The optional interval is the delay between evaluating the condition after it has failed
Example: | Wait Until Last Widget Is Enabled | 5 s | 10 ms |

kw.name: Wait Until Shell Closes
kw.doc:
Wait until the last selected shell widget closes or the optional timeout is reached. The optional interval is the delay between evaluating the condition after it has failed
Example: | Wait Until Shell Closes | 5 s | 10 ms |

kw.name: Wait Until Shell Is Active
kw.doc:
Wait until shell with given text is active or the optional timeout is reached. The optional interval is the delay between evaluating the condition after it has failed
Example: | Wait Until Shell Is Active | This is the shell text | 5 s | 10 ms |

kw.name: Wait Until Table Has Rows
kw.doc:
Wait until the last selected table have the proper number of rows or the optional timeout is reached. The optional interval is the delay between evaluating the condition after it has failed
Example: | Wait Until Table Has Rows | 5 s | 10 ms |

kw.name: Wait While Last Widget Is Enabled

Example: | Wait While Last Widget Is Enabled | 5 s | 10 ms |

Example: | Wait While Shell Closes | 5 s | 10 ms |

kw.name: Wait While Shell Is Active
kw.doc:
Wait while shell with given text is active or the optional timeout is reached. The optional interval is the delay between evaluating the condition after it has failed
Example: | Wait While Shell Is Active | This is the shell text | 5 s | 10 s |

kw.name: Wait While Table Has Rows
kw.doc:
Wait while the last selected table have the proper number of rows or the optional timeout is reached. The optional interval is the delay between evaluating the condition after it has failed
Example: | Wait While Table Has Rows | 5 s | 10 ms |
